title: How to Make Mysore Pak

steps.headline: Mix the chickpea flour and ghee together.
Grease a flat-bottomed plate with ghee.
steps.description: Keep it ready, as the mixture will be poured onto this for setting.

steps.headline: Heat the kadai or frying pan over medium heat or a flame.
Add sugar and water.
steps.description: Cook, stirring constantly, until it caramelizes. (Caramel forms when the sugar melts in the water and forms a thick solution.)

steps.headline: Once the caramelized sugar syrup is ready, add it to the dough.
steps.description: Mix the dough and caramelized sugar syrup over the heat or flame. Stir continuously while cooking, and add the remaining ghee to the mixture. The mixture will be ready once the ghee starts oozing out on the sides.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture on the greased plate.
steps.description: Keep it aside for 30 minutes, to set. If wished, sprinkle crystal sugar on the mixture once the dish has been poured to set. This will give the dish a nice appearance.

steps.headline: Cut into desired shapes once the dish has set.
steps.description: Squares, diamonds or triangles are some easy shapes to cut it into. Cut into the desired shapes within 2 to 3 minutes of pouring the mixture onto the plate, to ensure ease of cutting.

text: Preparation Mix the chickpea flour and ghee together. Mix into a soft dough. Grease a flat-bottomed plate with ghee. Keep it ready, as the mixture will be poured onto this for setting. Making the caramelized sugar syrup Heat the kadai or frying pan over medium heat or a flame.  Add sugar and water. Cook, stirring constantly, until it caramelizes. (Caramel forms when the sugar melts in the water and forms a thick solution.) Once the caramelized sugar syrup is ready, add it to the dough. Mix the dough and caramelized sugar syrup over the heat or flame. Stir continuously while cooking, and add the remaining ghee to the mixture. The mixture will be ready once the ghee starts oozing out on the sides. Forming the Mysore pak Pour the mixture on the greased plate. Keep it aside for 30 minutes, to set. If wished, sprinkle crystal sugar on the mixture once the dish has been poured to set. This will give the dish a nice appearance. Cut into desired shapes once the dish has set. Squares, diamonds or triangles are some easy shapes to cut it into. Cut into the desired shapes within 2 to 3 minutes of pouring the mixture onto the plate, to ensure ease of cutting.
